title: President for expediting digitalization of parliament
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 10 (APP): President Dr Arif Alvi on Wednesday called for expediting the process of digitalization of the parliament enabling it to handle the legislative business efficiently.
The President underlined that the country could not afford delay in the automation of the parliament and he asked all the relevant stakeholders to complete the project before its given timeline i.e., January 2023.
The president stated this while chairing a meeting on Presidentâ€™s Initiative for Cyber-Efficient Parliament, at Parliament House, today. Chairman Senate, Senator Muhammad Sadiq Sanjrani, Speaker National Assembly of Pakistan, Asad Qaiser, MNA, Sher Ali Arbab, Secretary National Assembly Secretariat, Tahir Hussain, Secretary Ministry of IT and Telecommunication, Dr Sohail Rajput, and Secretary Ministry of Planning, Development and Special Initiatives, Hamed Yaqoob Sheikh, attended the meeting.
He said it was imperative to adopt the latest information and communication tools so as to meet the challenges of the 4th Industrial Revolution.
He said that the automation of the parliament would increase the performance of both the Houses, besides helping in prompt and quick decision making.
He emphasized that the government was taking measures to digitally empower various ministries and divisions aiming to enhance accountability and transparency as well as improve service-delivery.
The meeting was apprised about the progress on the digitalization of the parliament. It was informed that the PC-1 of the project had been submitted to the Ministry of Planning, Development and Special Initiatives.
The meeting also constituted a steering committee to oversee the technicalities involved in the project and facilitate the digitalization of the Parliament.
